RAG.title: RAG vs Fine-tuning: When to Use Which (Industry Benchmarks)
RAG.summary: Recent benchmarks show that for knowledge-intensive tasks, RAG often outperforms fine-tuning when the knowledge base is large and evolving. However, retrieval quality — chunking and embedding choice — is the dominant factor; many production RAG systems fail due to retrieval failures rather than model limitations.
RAG.raw_snippet: RAG moves the failure mode from the model to the retrieval layer. Most teams are not measuring retrieval F1 in production.

data integration.title: The Hidden Cost of Siloed Data Pipelines
data integration.summary: Surveys indicate that data engineers spend 40%+ of their time on integration and pipeline glue rather than analytics. AI-assisted integration can reduce this, but only when the integration layer has visibility into schema and lineage.
data integration.raw_snippet: Siloed pipelines create invisible failure modes. Integration layers need to be observable.
